result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam Napoleon Washington

records.addlTxt:
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision, all other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to continue. 
-No possession of firearms. 
-No contact orders remain.

Defendant Adam Napoleon Washington appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court for Adam Napoleon Washington.  Student Intern Kyle Elderkin under the supervision of Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  Court hears arguments as to bail.  For reasons as set forth on the record, Court modifies bail to $500.00; Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision, all other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Defense requested status conference date; case to follow defendant's other case 21CF2103.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 02.  Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Adam Napoleon Washington in court by video with Attorney Daniel Mcmurray who appears in person.  Defendant Adam Napoleon Washington in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Christopher Monigold.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No reply from defendant/surety.  sb

Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court in person, defendant Adam Napoleon Washington not in court, in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defense moves to dismiss; motion is taken under advisement. Due to court congestion and the lateness of the hour, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Turnover to Justice Point LEVEL 5 supervision. No posession of firearms. Same prior conditions remain including no contact orders.

Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court, defendant Adam Napoleon Washington not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State is requesting a bail increase. Court orders $1,000 cash bond. Turnover to justice point level 5 supervision. No possession of firearms. No contact orders remain. Same prior conditions remain. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant missed court on 06-23-2022.  Defendant has been picked up on warrant and is currently in custody. Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 07-14-2022 at 8:30 am, Branch 2.  Parties notified.
Defendant/Surety's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant. ($500.00) LW

Pretrial Services Supervision Report 
bench warrant status
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for status. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Court ordered no contact with Officers D.L .Harmon C. Monigold, except as contact may be necessary in the officers' official duties
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Defendant fail to appear for court. Court ordered a stayed bench warrant. Court ordered Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Violation Report

22RM029414  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff
06/11/2022
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Adam Napoleon Washington in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Adam Napoleon Washington in custody.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adam Napoleon Washington appeared by video means with Attorney. Case retabbed to Branch 02 due to lower number case pending. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
